did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Genealogical material on the Peter Colt Family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains genealogical material on the Peter Colt Family. Of note is the typescript of writings of Catherine Wadsworth Colt (Mrs. Aaron S. Pennington), most of which she copied in 1856 from originals, that includes an autobiographical sketch written by Peter Colt in 1823, the year before he died.

extptr.title: Account of the Colt family : a copy of the original documents in the handwriting of Peter Colt [CSL call number StLib Archives 929.2 C715c]

relatedmaterial.p: Colt family letters, consisting of correspondence of Peter Colt and his family while in Connecticut, New Jersey, New York and Pennsylvania, 1775-1877. 68 documents [CSL call number StLib Archives 920 C73]
Colt Family Papers, 1777-1913, Rutgers University Library, Special Collections/University Archives, New Brunswick, N.J.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These papers are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These documents were given to the Connecticut State Library by Peter Colt Josephs (1939- ) on October 21, 2010.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: These documents were passed from Lyman Colt Josephs I (1853-1942) to his daughter Mary Josephs Fowler (1893-1980) to her executrix and second cousin Margaret Oliver Dunn Cromwell (1898-2002) to Mary Josephs Fowler's nephew Peter Colt Josephs (1939- ). Peter Colt Josephs is a second cousin once removed to Margaret Oliver Dunn Cromwell.
